show.title: Chop & Steele
show.headline: A comedy doc featuring childhood friends turned professional comedians

event.title: <show-title>Chop & Steele</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: The Found Footage Festival take their brand of comic mischief to the next level
event.description:
“A very funny and entertaining documentary about friendship, the art of comedy, and the skill and creativity it takes to execute the perfect practical joke – even if it lands you in serious legal trouble.” - Louisa Moore, Screen Zealots

When childhood friends Nick Prueher and Joe Pickett start booking their gag strongman routine on unsuspecting morning news shows, their pranks end up going viral, landing them in federal court with a vengeful media conglomerate.

All screenings will be followed by a Found Footage Festival performance by Nick and Joe with live Q&A. CHOP & STEELE is part of a double feature with A LIFE ON THE FARM, a documentary about the weirdest VHS tape Joe and Nick have ever seen. The film will feature a live intro and Q&A. Separate tickets are required for each film.

event.title: <show-title>Renfield</show-title> <event-type-title>Vampire Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: You are cordially invited to attend a garlic-free vampire screening
event.description: As immortal, unliving creatures of the night, we know how difficult it can be finding places to invite you in for an evening of leisure. That’s why we’re putting on our invite-only screening of Nicolas Cage and Nicholas Hoult’s new horror-comedy, RENFIELD, specifically designed with vampires in mind. We invite you to put on your best blood-sucking outfit (or whatever “human” clothes you have available) and join us for the film with a special, garlic-free menu – with plenty of Bloody Marys, of course. More ghoulish surprises await, including vampire fangs in case your familiars wish to fit in with the crowd.

eventType.title: Costume Screening
eventType.headline: You don’t need an excuse to dress up. But now you have one.
eventType.description: From James Bond Black Tie screenings to DESPERATELY SEEKING SUSAN ‘80s bashes to STAR WARS cosplay parties, we’ve got all the excuses you need to live your fully-costumed truth.

show.title: The Super Mario Bros. Movie
show.headline: Mario, Bowser, & Donkey Kong on the big screen – let's-a go!

event.title: <show-title>The Super Mario Bros. Movie</show-title> <event-type-title>Family Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: The most fun your family can have without a controller in their hands
event.description: It’s-a me, THE SUPER MARIO BROS. MOVIE Family Party! Never been to a Family Party? You’re in for a treat. Every Family Party features games, crafts, and fun props for you and your kids to enjoy before and after the movie. Travel with us to the Mushroom Kingdom for interactive games, crafting your own coin block, and themed props like mustaches, Mario hats and princess crowns, turtle shells, and more. It’s-a the ultimate way to see the Mario Bros.' first animated appearance on the big screen with your family. Your ticket includes the movie, the activities, and the props. Be sure to arrive up to 30 minutes early to give yourself plenty of time to get in on the fun.

eventType.title: Family Party
eventType.headline: Take the whole family to an immersive cinematic spectacular
eventType.description: Our lobbies become your family’s place to celebrate film in wacky and immersive ways, with themed games, hands-on crafts, and activities before the show.

titleCardImage.altText: Family Party TT2

show.title: The Devil's Backbone
show.headline: A gripping ghost yarn as only Guillermo del Toro could tell it

event.title: <show-title>The Devil's Backbone</show-title>
event.headline: A gripping ghost yarn as only Guillermo del Toro could tell it
event.description:
Set during the Spanish Civil War, Guillermo del Toro's haunting ghost story follows a 12-year-old boy left at a rural orphanage after the death of his freedom-fighter father. As frightening as it is personal, del Toro's movie masterfully weaves together gothic-inspired scares, a deeply disturbing mystery, and historical melodrama to explore the horrors waiting for us both on and off the mortal coil. THE DEVIL'S BACKBONE serves as a companion piece to del Toro's Oscar-winning PAN'S LABYRINTH. Don't miss a new 4K restoration of this bone-chilling classic.

Presented in Spanish with English subtitles

show.title: Event Horizon
show.headline: A haunted ship. A missing crew. An infinite evil.

event.title: <show-title>Event Horizon</show-title>
event.headline: A mall-goth rampage through the cosmos
event.description:
Seven years ago, a starship known as Event Horizon went missing. A rescue squad led by Captain Miller (Laurence Fishburne, THE MATRIX) and Dr. Weir (Sam Neill, POSSESSION) discovers that the ship has mysteriously returned...but it brought something with it. EVENT HORIZON is what happens when filmmaker Paul W.S. Anderson (RESIDENT EVIL) throws his favorite horror movies in a blender, hits “liquify,” and churns out an ultra-violent, mall-goth variant of HELLRAISER...in space. With a hallucinogenic production design and an adorable amount of sincerity, this movie-as-a-carnival-ride proves once and for all that CD-ROMs will never go out of style – even in 2047.

Screening from an archival 35mm print

show.title: Pulse (2001)
show.headline: The original Japanese cult classic

event.title: <show-title>Pulse (2001)</show-title>
event.headline: The original Japanese cult classic.
event.description: Before THE GRUDGE, before DARK WATER, there was PULSE, one of the scariest films ever made by the master of Japanese horror, Kiyoshi Kurosawa. A group of young friends is rocked by the sudden suicide of one of their own. When his ghostly image appears on their computer screens, something far more horrifying is unleashed. The terror mounts as more deaths and disappearances occur. Kurosawa’s PULSE is a psychologically unsettling tale, which effects will endure long after the chills have subsided.

show.title: The Blob (1988)
show.headline: Bigger, better, and BLOBBIER.

event.title: <show-title>The Blob (1988)</show-title>
event.headline: Bigger, better, and blobbier.
event.description:
Helmed by the team behind A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 3: DREAM WARRIORS, THE BLOB joins John Carpenter’s THE THING and David Cronenberg’s THE FLY as one of the most electrifying horror remakes of the 1980s. The movie mixes YA vibes with Stephen King-styled government conspiracy theories to provide a foundation for what we’re all here to see—breathtaking special effects featuring the neon-tinged, human-ingestion machine known as the Blob.

Screening the 4K restoration.

show.title: The Descent
show.headline: An essential benchmark of 21st century horror

event.title: <show-title>The Descent</show-title>
event.headline: A benchmark of 21st century horror
event.description:
Just when you thought it was safe to go cave spelunking, you hit THE DESCENT. After a tragic car accident, emotionally wounded Sarah (Shauna MacDonald) joins five friends on a cave expedition in the Appalachian Mountains. But questionable decisions leave the group trapped underground and alone . . . except for the subhumanoid slime-monsters. THE DESCENT feels like what would happen if Stanley Kubrick directed THE TEXAS CHAIN SAW MASSACRE in a cave with an amazing ensemble cast of women. Writer-director Neil Marshall (DOG SOLDIERS) delivers high tension and goopy violence over a foundation of empathy, friendship and survival.

Screening the theatrical cut from an archival 35mm print.

show.title: Videodrome
show.headline: David Cronenberg's uncut vision, newly restored

event.title: <show-title>Videodrome</show-title>
event.headline: Long live the new flesh.
event.description: VIDEODROME is everything. On the hunt for edgy shows for his sleazy cable TV station, Max Renn (James Woods) stumbles across “Videodrome,” a pirate broadcast of hyperviolent hell. As Renn unearths the origins of the program, he embarks on a hallucinatory journey into an underworld of conspiracies, sadomasochistic sex, and bodily transformation. Starring Debbie Harry from new wave legends Blondie in an early role, VIDEODROME is one of filmmaker David Cronenberg’s most original and provocative works, fusing social commentary with shocking sex and violence. Featuring jaw-dropping special effects makeup by Rick Baker, this is one of the most influential and mind-bending genre films of the 1980s.

show.title: Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!
show.headline: The hot-rod girl gang classic back on the big screen in 35mm

landscapeHeroImage.altText: scene from Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!

portraitHeroImage.altText: scene from Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!

posterImages.altText: movie poster for Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!

event.title: <show-title>Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!</show-title>
event.headline: The hot-rod girl gang classic back on the big screen in 35mm
event.description:
NYC: Hosted by Heather Buckley (Black Mansion Films)

"Welcome to violence..."

This is the movie promised in all of those exploitation trailers from the era with their screaming copy and hyperbolic narration. Those other movies are all disappointing on some level, but FASTER, PUSSYCAT not only fulfills its checklist of sex, violence, and rock n' roll, but it also adds qualities one wouldn't even expect were possible in this realm of filmmaking. Notoriously breast-obsessed legend Russ Meyer is a triple threat as a writer, director, and editor, delivering intense, graphically powerful compositions and jawbreaking tough gal dialogue at a breakneck speed. The singularly diabolic Tura Satana (in a role so wicked you can't help but root for her as the villain) leads an all-female hot rod gang as they terrorize wimpy men, valley girls, and simple country folk. It starts out like a beach party movie, then before you can say "like a velvet glove cast in iron," it goes all hothouse Southern Gothic melodrama complete with fainting spells, hidden loot, a "ghost," and a man child petting a kitten. Then it gets real sexy and dangerous. It's too much sensation for three movies, but it's all here in this one.

35mm print courtesy of RM Films.

show.title: Happiness of the Katakuris
show.headline: A fairly typical murder musical about family

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Ww happiness of the katakuris hero

portraitHeroImage.altText: Happiness of the katakuris sp portrait

posterImages.altText: Ww happiness of the katakuris poster

event.title: <show-title>Happiness of the Katakuris</show-title>
event.headline: A fairly typical murder musical about family
event.description:
Prolific Japanese director Takashi Miike has done everything from traditional samurai dramas to superhero movies. He may make one movie about the yakuza and another about vampires or a third about both. He's totally wild and unpredictable which makes HAPPINESS OF THE KATAKURIS the perfect playground for his imagination. It's a musical, it's a family drama, it's a murder mystery, it's a comedy. There's animation, surreal dance numbers, and zombies. A brief summary could indicate that it's about a family attempting to run a bed and breakfast in the Japanese countryside despite a high mortality rate among their guests, but that doesn't quite communicate how ridiculous and fun it is to watch the chaos unfold. Strangest of all, buried between the claymation monstrosities and undead sumo wrestlers is a sweet and tender center: the Katakuri family!

Restoration courtesy of Arrow Video and the American Genre Film Archive.

show.title: Times Square
show.headline: Punk girls vs. the world, newly restored

event.title: <show-title>Times Square</show-title>
event.headline: Punk girls vs the world
event.description: A perfect snapshot of teen rebellion and friendship between outsiders with a backdrop of Times Square as the seediest playground on Earth. With a classic soundtrack of punk and new wave, TIMES SQUARE has become a favorite of "sleez sisters" everywhere. While it may have had its explicit lesbian love story cut out, there's no denying the special bond between Pam and Nicki as they run amok in New York City, guided by the voice of Tim Curry. The two don trash bags and bandit masks, form a punk band, smash TVs, and experience a smidgeon of being free in a world that is actively trying to stomp out their personalities.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Clueless
show.headline: The essential ‘90s teen comedy

event.title: <show-title>Clueless</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Make a cameo at this interactive party
event.description:
Before reinventing Jane Austen became cliché, Amy Heckerling adapted the classic story of Emma into a hilarious, insanely clever satire of adolescence in Beverly Hills. CLUELESS spawned fashion trends, countless slang terms (AS IF!), and gave Alicia Silverstone a reason to exist beyond Aerosmith videos. Over 20 years later(!), we are still majorly, totally, butt-crazy in love with this movie.

At this special interactive screening, we'll roll with the homies and say all of our favorite lines together, plus we'll have props to help us pretend that, for one glorious night, we're the Class of '95 at Bronson Alcott High School.

We'll play matchmaker for sweet old teachers, make a cameo at the Val party, and thank an LA city bus driver for taking a chance on an unknown kid. So slip on your Calvin Klein dress – or come dressed as any of your favorite characters (the more Dionnes, the better!) – and make time in your busy pants-dropping schedule to attend.

Over 20 years later(!), we are still majorly, totally, butt-crazy in love with this movie.

show.title: Selena
show.headline: Jennifer Lopez plays the queen of Tejano music

event.title: <show-title>Selena</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Feel the bidi bidi bom bom at this interactive screening
event.description:
Join us at this very special Movie Party as we celebrate the life and music of one of America’s most beloved icons, Selena Quintanilla-Pérez. Sure, we could just sit quietly and watch the magnificent 1997 film SELENA, starring Jennifer Lopez in a star-making performance. But we think the best way to honor Selena is to share in the joy of her music.

Whether you want to sing along or use any of the fun props we’ll have available when you arrive, you are strongly encouraged to lose yourself in all of Selena's classic songs while you enjoy the film. So throw on a rhinestone bra...oops, we mean bustier, and get ready for a music-filled Movie Party worthy of the Queen of Tejano music.

show.title: Tammy and the T-Rex
show.headline: The unholy mash-up of Beverly Hills 90210 and JURASSIC PARK, fully restored

posterImages.altText: Sf tammy and the trex poster

event.title: <show-title>Tammy and the T-Rex</show-title>
event.headline: The unholy mash-up of Beverly Hills 90210 and JURASSIC PARK, fully restored
event.description:
Directed by Stewart Raffill (MAC AND ME, THE ICE PIRATES), TAMMY AND THE T-REX is a love story as old as time.

This post-JURASSIC jam stars Denise Richards (STARSHIP TROOPERS, WILD THINGS) and the late Paul Walker (THE FAST AND THE FURIOUS) in an unprecedented mishmash of rom-com tropes and R-rated horror thrills. When Paul's mauled by the local zoo’s toothier residents, his love affair with Denise doesn’t cease — even after his brain is transplanted into an ancient animatronic predator. Oh, and did we mention “Bernie” from WEEKEND AT BERNIE’S is the villain?

Originally filmed as a gorefest w/ impressive splatter by SFX guru John Carl Buechler, TAMMY’s only minimal release back in the day was cut to PG-13, funneled straight-to-video and inexplicably marketed as a “kids’ film.” Thanks to the intrepid efforts of top-notch archival pals Vinegar Syndrome, this gonzo gem is fully restored and ready to scorch your audience's ganglia into dust! (American Genre Film Archive)

Restoration courtesy of Vinegar Syndrome and the American Genre Film Archive.

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Silver Bullet
show.headline: When darkness falls, terror rises.

event.title: <show-title>Silver Bullet</show-title>
event.headline: Don't miss this werewolf classic, screening along with a graphic novel signing
event.description:
WHERE WOLF - a new creator-owned graphic novel from creative team Rob Saucedo, Debora Lancianese and Jack Morelli - is set in the wild world of furry conventions, small-town Texas journalism and werewolf whodunit.

Leading up to the wide release of the book, writer and Graveyard Shift programmer Rob Saucedo will tour movie theaters across the country - screening werewolf films and providing an opportunity to purchase the graphic novel early at concurrent signing events.

In WHERE WOLF, something scary stalks the streets of Texas, leaving a trail of corpses in its wake. The only person standing in its way is Larry Chaney, a slacker reporter who can’t hold a job, can’t keep a girlfriend, and can’t stop getting in the way of his own career. Larry must go undercover at a local furry convention if he has any hope of stopping the beast dead set on turning the gathered attendees into an all-you-can-eat buffet. The graphic novel is a love letter to werewolf fans, with an irreverent bent that takes decades of lycanthropic lore to new heights and surprising places.

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
WHERE WOLF - a new creator-owned graphic novel from creative team Rob Saucedo, Debora Lancianese and Jack Morelli - is set in the wild world of furry conventions, small-town Texas journalism and werewolf whodunit.

Leading up to the wide release of the book, writer and Graveyard Shift programmer Rob Saucedo will tour movie theaters across the country - screening werewolf films and providing an opportunity to purchase the graphic novel early at concurrent signing events.

In WHERE WOLF, something scary stalks the streets of Texas, leaving a trail of corpses in its wake. The only person standing in its way is Larry Chaney, a slacker reporter who can’t hold a job, can’t keep a girlfriend, and can’t stop getting in the way of his own career. Larry must go undercover at a local furry convention if he has any hope of stopping the beast dead set on turning the gathered attendees into an all-you-can-eat buffet. The graphic novel is a love letter to werewolf fans, with an irreverent bent that takes decades of lycanthropic lore to new heights and surprising places.

eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.title: 2D Digital
formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

formats.title: 3D Digital
formats.headline: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!
formats.description: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages will be allowed at all screenings of this show.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG-13 (Standard)
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated R
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

queues.queueMessage: Welcome to the virtual line for GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY VOL. 3. We appreciate your patience. Your tickets will be available shortly. Feel free to browse available seats while you wait. When you reach the front of the line you'll be able to select seats and proceed to the next step.
queues.activeMessage: Due to high demand for GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY VOL. 3, you'll need to get in a virtual line when tickets go on sale. We recommend getting in line as soon as it opens as we anticipate showtimes filling up fast.
queues.eventMessage: Get ready, GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY VOL. 3 tickets are in high demand. We will begin forming a virtual line for tickets soon.
